SECTION THREE
CURRENT PROPOSALS - A BRIEF DESCRIPTION
Surprisingly few proposals have come to the
agency which describe the need for involvement
in the mass communications media. What does
exist in the files of the Education Division -
CAP, typifies the inability of even interested
individuals and agencies to develop program ideas
well enough.
We have received requests to fund research
projects in the use of television in education,
develop consumer education kinds of programs
for television, programs which describe the
economic traps in such things as "installment
buying", "home ownership plans", "automobile
purchase plans". Basically, these programs are
more closely related to a type of commercial
television "Buy Brand Name Products" pitch
which seemed directed more at the business
community than the poverty population.
